subject: Re: Hey guys, can you please have a look at corpsecint.com.au? It seems...

full_threads.body:
You are most welcome!

And remember, if you need help or have some questions, we are just a click away! I'll go ahead and close this conversation. However, if you do need further assistance you can simply reply and the conversation will be reopened or you can just start a new conversation. Have a great day!

This is the #KinstaLife

--
Olufemi from Kinsta
On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:47 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Thanks Olufemi - We will action as requested.

On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:44 PM, "Olufemi Adeleke" <olufemi.adeleke@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

We've completed the repair of the infected site.

* The WordPress core was infected and reinstalled at version 5.3.2.

There were several malicious files found within the site that I've moved to private/suspected.

As a precaution, I have reset the site's SFTP and Database passwords. Additionally, any old backups containing Malware have been removed from the site. I've taken a manual backup for you of the clean-state of the site in case you need to restore it.

There are some action items that you will need to take in order to protect the site:

* /www/corpsec_861/public/wp-content/themes/tpdhlisy.php was infected. I've cleaned it manually but you may want to reinstall the theme 'tpdhlisy from the theme author to prevent re-infections.

* The plugin 'ultimate-elementor' was infected. Since it is not available on the WordPress workshop, I was unable to reinstall it. It has been deactivated/moved to private/suspected and should be reinstalled from the plugin author's website.

Below you will see a list of all WordPress users with administrator access to the site. Please review this list carefully and then log into your site and delete any administrators that are no longer needed or that you do not recognize:

5    corpsec-heath   Heath   heath@wpperk.com       2019-04-03 23:48:51     administrator

3  descorp Des Lacy        des@corpsecint.com.au     2018-07-17 07:22:46     administrator

4  wpperk-support  WP Perk Support support@wpperk.com   2019-02-19 06:24:39     administrator

2  zoannon Glenn Goodman   glenn@aussietechheads.com.au       2018-07-13 04:19:26     administrator

As a preventative measure we have updated the WordPress salts in the wp-config.php file. This will have the effect of causing all users to be logged out of the site. So all users will have to log in the next time they access the site.

In addition, please note that the SFTP/SSH and database passwords have been changed. The next time you use SFTP/SSH or access phpMyAdmin you will need to use the updated passwords.

We would ask that you take the following steps within the next 24 hours:

* Install any available updates to the WordPress core and the site's themes and plugins.

* Require all administrators to change their WordPress passwords.

* Require all MyKinsta users to change their passwords.

Known vulnerabilities in older versions of plugins, themes, and the WordPress core are a common point of entry for malicious activity. As a result, it is our policy that any site that has been infected with malware must have the WordPress core, as well as all plugins and themes updated to the latest version within 24 hours of repair. If this is not done the site will no longer be eligible for future free malware removal.

Please notify us as soon as updates have been applied so that we can update our records to reflect that all updates have been applied.

Finally, please note that we have disabled the theme and plugin editors in the WordPress admin area. While we recommend leaving these disabled permanently, if you do use them you can reenable them after all users have updated their passwords by removing these lines from your site's wp-config.php file:

##Disable Editing in Dashboard

define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);

Let us know if you have any questions!

On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:10 PM, "Olufemi Adeleke" <olufemi.adeleke@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

The site is quite heavily infected

I am making a backup and cleaning it now.

On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:06 PM, "Olufemi Adeleke" <olufemi.adeleke@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

I noticed it loads fine on my end as well, I will scan the site and circle back.

On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:06 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Thanks Olufemi. I just found an admin account that was fake and when I deleted it the site loaded fine again.

I'll be interested to see the results of the scan.

On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:02 PM, "Olufemi Adeleke" <olufemi.adeleke@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there! i will investigate this and scan the site for malware.

On Mon, Mar 9, 2020 at 04:01 PM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hey guys, can you please have a look at corpsecint.com.au? It seems to be redirecting to another URL and I have a feeling it may have been hacked...
